intro: Nonatelia constricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Linaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a fibrous root system and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Nonatelia constricta is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in fiber production.
